hypothesis_content.title: BTC Post-Holiday Mean Reversion in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >3% price decline during the final 4 hours of a US trading day (3-7 PM EST) while the market regime is NEUTRAL (confidence >55%), a long entry at the close will generate positive alpha over the next 12 hours as institutional and algorithmic flows correct the exaggerated end-of-session move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often exhibit mean-reverting behavior. End-of-day sell-offs can be exacerbated by profit-taking, margin calls, or low-liquidity algorithmic trading, creating temporary dislocations. Overnight and early Asian session flows tend to correct these moves, especially for BTC as the benchmark asset.
entry_conditions: BTC 4-hour return from 3 PM to 7 PM EST < -3%
Enter long BTC at 7:01 PM EST market close

exit_conditions.take_profit: 12 hours after entry OR +2.5% return, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.time_exit: 12 hours after entry (7 AM EST next day)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 12-hour return after entry is <= 0% over 50+ occurrences in backtest, or win rate < 55%.
